Wagner Labor ArchiveElmer Holmes Bobst Library70 Washington Square South2nd FloorNew York, NY 10012(212) 998-2596special.collections@nyu.eduThis finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace 2022-07-13T18:38:00 Websites are in English.
Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
ACT-UAW, Local 7902 Archived Websites
International Union, United Automobile, Aerospace, and Agricultural Implement Workers of America. Local 7902. (New York, N.Y.)
WAG.370
3 websites in 3 archived websites.
October 2013-ongoing ACT-UAW Local 7902 represents over 4,000 part-time and adjunct teachers at the New School and New York University. This collection is consists of the websites for Local 7902, dating back to 2013. The union is made-up of four bargaining units, the New York University Adjuncts, New School Part-Time Faculty (PTF), New School Student Employees (SENS), and New School Student Health Services Employees (SHENS).
Historical Note
ACT-UAW Local 7902 (Adjuncts Come Together, in some early contracts they also have gone by Academics Coming Together) represents over 4,000 part-time and adjunct teachers at the New School and New York University. The union was formed in 2002 by adjuncts at NYU, which first ratified their first contract in 2004 and elected their first executive officers in 2005. In 2004, adjuncts at the New School began to negotiate, and reached an agreement with the New School in 2005. The union has successfully negotiated better pay, job security, partially subsidized health care, pension benefits, and promoted transparency within the universities' budgetary systems. In 2015, Tandon adjuncts voted yes for union representation.
In 2015, academic student workers at the New School began organizing under Local 7902. In 2017, they voted to form a union and went on strike in 2018. They won a contract with the New School. During the COVID-19 pandemic, New School part-time faculty voted to ratify a pandemic recovery plan. In 2022, contract negotiations began for New School and New York University adjunct teachers.
Scope and Contents
This collection is consists of the websites for ACT-UAW, Local 7902, dating back to 2013. The union is made-up of four bargaining units, the New York University Adjuncts, New School Part-Time Faculty (PTF), New School Student Employees (SENS), and New School Student Health Services Employees (SHENS). The websites contain current and past contracts, memoranda of agreement, summaries of rights and benefits, arbitrations, information about their committees and stewards, election results, bargaining updates, strike authorizations, events, news from the union's president, their newsletter, and a gallery of their members' art. Issues of the newsletter, Adjunct Voice, date from 2006-2009.
The website has redesigned three times since crawling began, once in 2014, 2017, and mid-2021.
Take Down Policy
Archived websites are made accessible for purposes of education and research. NYU Libraries have given attribution to rights holders when possible; however, due to the nature of archival collections, we are not always able to identify this information.
If you hold the rights to materials in our archived websites that are unattributed, please let us know so that we may maintain accurate information about these materials.
If you are a rights holder and are concerned that you have found material on this website for which you have not granted permission (or is not covered by a copyright exception under US copyright laws), you may request the removal of the material from our site by submitting a notice, with the elements described below, to the special.collections@nyu.edu.
Please include the following in your notice: Identification of the material that you believe to be infringing and information sufficient to permit us to locate the material; your contact information, such as an address, telephone number, and email address; a statement that you are the owner, or authorized to act on behalf of the owner, of an exclusive right that is allegedly infringed and that you have a good-faith belief that use of the material in the manner complained of is not authorized by the copyright owner, its agent, or the law; a statement that the information in the notification is accurate and made under penalty of perjury; and your physical or electronic signature. Upon receiving a notice that includes the details listed above, we will remove the allegedly infringing material from public view while we assess the issues identified in your notice.
Conditions Governing Access
Open to researchers without restrictions.
Conditions Governing Use
This collection is protected by copyright and/or related rights. You are free to use materials in the collection in any way that is permitted by the copyright and related rights legislation that applies to your use. For other uses you need to obtain permission from the rights-holder(s).
Arrangement
Websites are arranged by date.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; ACT-UAW, Local 7902 Archived Websites; WAG 370; Wayback URL; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
In 2013, http://www.actuaw.org/ was initially selected by curators and captured through the use of The California Digital Library's Web Archiving Service in 2013 as part of the Labor Unions and Organizations (U.S.) Web Archive. In November 2015, the website was migrated to Archive-It. Archive-It uses web crawling technology to capture websites at a scheduled time and displays only an archived copy, from the resulting WARC file, of the website. In May 2022, https://youarethenewschool.com/ was added. The accession number associated with this website is 2022.062.
Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
Due to technical or privacy issues, archived websites may not be exact copies of the original website at the time of the web crawl. Certain file types will not be captured dependent on how they are embedded in the site. Other parts of websites that the crawler has difficulty capturing includes Javascript, streaming content, database-driven content, and highly interactive content. Full-Text searches of archived websites are available at https://archive-it.org/organizations/567.
Accruals
New site crawls are accrued semiannually. During the COVID-19 pandemic, websites were accrued monthly.
Appraisal
Robots.txt (a piece of code designed to limit crawler activity within a website) was ignored. Websites were rescoped to include Google Documents.
Processing Information
The collection was maintained by Nicole Greenhouse. Maintenance of the collection consisted of rescoping due to missing captured content, redirects and content drift, missing embedded materials (such as videos or attached Google documents and pdfs), and other materials created by selected entities. The finding aid was created in July 2022.
